name: treatment of used refrigerant R134a, final disposal | used refrigerant R134a | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/14269/documentation

This dataset represent treatment of used refrigerant R134a by final disposal (incineration). Since specific treatment of R134a refrigerant by incineration is not yet available in the database a proxy - treatment of average hazardous waste by incineration - is used.;The refrigerant R134a is widely used refrigerant (mainly in automobile air conditioning systems and othere refrigeration and cooling technologies). It can be treated by primary three different technologies; 1) venting, 2) reclamation and 3) final disposal. ;Since the R134a causes global warming venting as a way of treatment is forbidden in some countries. For example in the US (US EPA, http://www.epa.gov/ozone/title6/608/faq.html, accessed 20141105).

The activity starts, when the used refrigerant is accepted for treatment.

There are no data on the amount of energy needed during this process.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3822:Treatment and disposal of hazardous waste

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Final disposal of R134a refers to the destruction of used HFC-134a. This disposal may be necessary when the refrigerant has become badly contaminated with other products and no longer meets the acceptance specifications to be reclaimed (reprocessed back to usable refrigerant).

flow.name: used refrigerant R134a
flow.category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3822:Treatment and disposal of hazardous waste

exchanges.description: Estimated value. It is estimated, that during the final disposal 0.1% of the refrigerant is emitted to air.

Calculated value.

This exchange (average hazardous waste incineration) is a proxy to the specific incineration of the R134a, When an incineration of R134a is available in the database this product can be replaced by it.

flow.name: hazardous waste, for incineration
flow.category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3822:Treatment and disposal of hazardous waste
